episodeTitle: Hard Battles, One After Another! Devil Fruit Eaters vs. Devil Fruit Eaters!
description: Luffy, together with Jinbe, Ivankov, and the Newkamas, battle through the Marines while Buggy unexpectedly forms an alliance with Whitebeard. Jinbe quickly defeats Moria, but Luffy faces trouble against Smoker until Hancock furiously intervenes. Meanwhile, Ivankov confronts Bartholomew Kuma and learns from Doflamingo that the Kuma he knew is dead.

events.title: Luffy and Allies Advance Through Marines
events.description: Luffy, together with Jinbe, Emporio Ivankov, and the Newkama army, charge through the Marine forces on the battlefield. They face overwhelming numbers of Marine soldiers but push forward with determination to reach Ace.
events.significance: Demonstrates the growing alliance between Luffy and the Impel Down escapees as they work together to breach the Marine defenses at Marineford.

events.title: Whitebeard Orders to Sink Marine Ships
events.description: Whitebeard commands the Decalvan Brothers and all allied pirates to change their strategy and focus on sinking the surrounding Marine warships to prevent encirclement and cut off potential Marine reinforcements.
events.significance: Shows Whitebeard's tactical leadership during the war and his ability to adapt the battle strategy in real-time to protect his forces and create opportunities for rescue.

quotes.text: Decalvan Brothers, command all pirates and sink the Marine ships around us!
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Whitebeard adapting his strategy during the heat of battle

events.title: Buggy Forms Alliance with Whitebeard
events.description: After being overheard planning to kill Whitebeard, Buggy is confronted by the Yonko. Whitebeard cleverly offers Buggy an alliance, pointing out that the Impel Down prisoners under Buggy's command would be valuable allies. Buggy accepts, and his followers are amazed that Whitebeard treats Buggy as an equal.
events.significance: This comedic moment showcases both Buggy's tendency to get caught up in situations beyond his abilities and Whitebeard's strategic thinking to gain allies. It also demonstrates how Buggy's reputation continues to grow despite his actual strength.

quotes.speaker: Marco
quotes.context: Marco commenting on how easily Whitebeard manipulated Buggy into an alliance

events.title: Jinbe vs Gecko Moria
events.description: Gecko Moria attempts to attack Luffy, but Jinbe intercepts him and engages in combat. Using his Fish-Man Karate and superior combat skills, Jinbe quickly overwhelms and defeats Moria, demonstrating the power difference between them.
events.significance: Shows Jinbe's strength as a former Warlord and his commitment to protecting Luffy during the war. It also demonstrates that not all Warlords are equal in power, with Jinbe clearly superior to Moria in this encounter.

events.title: Smoker Attacks Luffy
events.description: As Luffy advances across the battlefield, Tashigi spots him and alerts Smoker. Smoker immediately engages Luffy in combat, using his Moku Moku no Mi powers and Seastone-tipped jitte. Luffy struggles against Smoker's Logia intangibility and the Seastone weapon that can negate his Devil Fruit powers.
events.significance: Continues the long-running rivalry between Smoker and Luffy, showing that despite Luffy's growth, Smoker remains a formidable opponent. The fight demonstrates how dangerous Smoker's combination of Logia powers and Seastone weapon makes him.

events.title: Hancock Intervenes to Save Luffy
events.description: When Smoker pins Luffy down with his Seastone jitte and is about to capture him, Boa Hancock furiously intervenes. She uses her Armament Haki to kick Smoker away from Luffy, openly defying her position as a Warlord to protect the man she loves.
events.significance: This is a pivotal moment showing Hancock's complete loyalty to Luffy over her obligations to the World Government. Her public intervention makes it clear that she has chosen Luffy's side in the war, risking her Warlord status and the safety of Amazon Lily.

quotes.text: Are you going to resign from the Shichibukai as well?
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker questioning Hancock's actions after she attacks him to save Luffy

quotes.text: I am deafened by anger! I will kill you!
quotes.speaker: Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock's furious response to Smoker for attacking Luffy

events.title: Hancock Uses Armament Haki Against Smoker
events.description: Hancock demonstrates her mastery of Armament Haki by using it to strike Smoker, a Logia-type Devil Fruit user. Her Haki allows her to make physical contact with Smoker's smoke body and send him flying.
events.significance: This is the first clear demonstration of Hancock using Armament Haki in the anime, showing viewers how Haki can be used to counter Logia users. It foreshadows the importance of Haki in future arcs.

events.title: Ivankov Confronts Bartholomew Kuma
events.description: Emporio Ivankov encounters Bartholomew Kuma on the battlefield and attempts to speak to his old friend and Revolutionary Army comrade. However, Kuma attacks Ivankov without recognition or hesitation, showing no sign of the person Ivankov once knew.
events.significance: This heartbreaking moment shows the tragic fate of Kuma, who has been fully transformed into a mindless weapon. It demonstrates the cruelty of the World Government and sets up the revelation about Kuma's sacrifice.

events.title: Doflamingo Reveals Kuma's Transformation
events.description: Donquixote Doflamingo explains to Ivankov that 'the Kuma you knew before is dead.' He reveals that Vegapunk completed Kuma's transformation into a Pacifista (PX-0), and that Kuma has lost all of his will and humanity, becoming nothing more than a weapon of the World Government.
events.significance: This revelation is a major plot point that explains Kuma's strange behavior and hints at the dark experiments of Dr. Vegapunk. It also raises questions about why Kuma volunteered for this transformation and what he sacrificed, setting up future story developments.

quotes.text: The Kuma you knew before is dead.
quotes.speaker: Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo revealing to Ivankov that Kuma has been completely transformed into a mindless Pacifista

events.title: Devil Fruit Users Clash Across the Battlefield
events.description: The episode showcases numerous battles between Devil Fruit users on both sides of the war. Marines with Devil Fruit abilities clash with pirate Devil Fruit users, creating spectacular displays of various powers across the battlefield.
events.significance: This moment emphasizes the scale and chaos of the Marineford War, with the episode title reflecting the unprecedented number of ability users fighting simultaneously. It demonstrates the World Government's military might.

quotes.text: Decalvan Brothers, command all pirates and sink the Marine ships around us!
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Whitebeard directing his allied forces during the battle

quotes.speaker: Marco
quotes.context: Marco commenting on Whitebeard's successful manipulation of Buggy

quotes.text: Are you going to resign from the Shichibukai as well?
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker questioning Hancock after she attacks him

quotes.text: I am deafened by anger! I will kill you!
quotes.speaker: Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock's furious response to Smoker for attacking Luffy

quotes.text: The Kuma you knew before is dead.
quotes.speaker: Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo revealing Kuma's complete transformation to Ivankov

themes.description: The episode explores themes of sacrifice through Hancock risking her position for Luffy and the revelation of Kuma's transformation. Characters demonstrate loyalty to their causes and loved ones despite the personal costs.
themes.symbolism: Kuma's loss of humanity represents the ultimate sacrifice, while Hancock's defiance of the World Government symbolizes choosing love over duty.

themes.description: The Marineford War's intensity is on full display with multiple simultaneous battles between powerful Devil Fruit users. The episode title emphasizes the unprecedented scale of ability users clashing.
themes.symbolism: The chaotic battlefield with numerous Devil Fruit powers represents the breakdown of order and the high stakes of the conflict.

themes.description: Buggy's alliance with Whitebeard and Luffy's growing coalition of supporters show how war creates strange partnerships between former enemies or unlikely allies.
themes.symbolism: Buggy being treated as Whitebeard's equal despite the vast power difference symbolizes how perception and reputation can diverge from reality.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy continues his desperate push to save Ace, facing overwhelming opposition from Marine forces. His determination attracts allies like Hancock and Jinbe who fight to protect him.
keyActions: Charges through Marine forces with Jinbe and Ivankov

characterSpotlights.development: Hancock openly defies her Warlord position to protect Luffy, demonstrating the depth of her feelings and her willingness to sacrifice everything for him. Her use of Haki against Smoker shows her combat prowess.
keyActions: Intervenes to save Luffy from Smoker
Uses Armament Haki to strike a Logia user
Openly declares her intent to kill Smoker
quotes: I am deafened by anger! I will kill you!

characterSpotlights.development: Ivankov experiences the tragedy of encountering his transformed friend Kuma, learning the heartbreaking truth about what happened to his Revolutionary Army comrade.
keyActions: Fights alongside Luffy through the Marines
Learns from Doflamingo about Kuma's fate

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe demonstrates his strength and loyalty by quickly defeating Moria to protect Luffy, showing that he takes his alliance with Luffy seriously.
Smoker continues his pursuit of Luffy, demonstrating increased strength since their last encounter. His determination to capture Luffy shows his dedication to Marine justice.
keyActions: Attacks Luffy after Tashigi spots him
Uses Seastone jitte to pin Luffy down
quotes: Are you going to resign from the Shichibukai as well?

characterSpotlights.development: Kuma's complete transformation into a mindless weapon is revealed, showing the tragic end of the kind revolutionary who helped the Straw Hats.
Doflamingo takes pleasure in revealing Kuma's fate to Ivankov, showcasing his cruel nature and knowledge of World Government secrets.
quotes: The Kuma you knew before is dead.

characterSpotlights.development: Buggy continues to stumble into prestigious alliances, this time with Whitebeard himself, further inflating his undeserved reputation.
Whitebeard demonstrates his tactical brilliance by manipulating Buggy into an alliance and adapting his battle strategy to counter Marine movements.
keyActions: Forms alliance with Buggy to gain Impel Down prisoners
Orders forces to sink Marine ships
quotes: Decalvan Brothers, command all pirates and sink the Marine ships around us!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several battle sequences with additional action scenes and reactions from various characters to fill the episode runtime.

trivia.fact: This episode corresponds to Chapter 559 of the manga, titled 'Destiny' (天命 / Tenmei).
The opening theme 'One day' by The ROOTLESS is notable for being more somber in tone compared to previous openings, reflecting the serious nature of the Marineford War arc.
This episode marks one of the first clear demonstrations of Armament Haki in the anime, with Hancock using it to strike Smoker's Logia body.
The revelation about Kuma being 'dead' in Episode 468 sets up a mystery that wouldn't be fully explained until much later in the series during the Egghead Arc.
Episode 468 received a 9.2/10 rating on IMDb, reflecting the high quality and emotional impact of the Marineford Arc episodes.
The episode aired on September 26, 2010 in Japan, during the height of the Marineford Arc's popularity.
Buggy's alliance with Whitebeard in this episode is a continuation of his tendency to fail upward, a running gag throughout the series that eventually leads to him becoming a Yonko.
